G4822-d-07-10-00-WC.Narrative: WC TRAIN LO11, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 27 LOADS AND 9 EMPTIES WAS WORKING ON TRACK 605 AT APPROXIMATELY 5 MPH.  THE CREW HAD SHOVED TO THE LIMIT.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN WALKED BACK AND CUT THE CROSSING. HE THEN WALKED TO CUT CUT A CAR TO THE MAIN WHEN HE TOLD HIS ENGINEER TO GO AHEAD.  AS THE ENGINEER WAS PULLING AHEAD, THE CONDUCTOR HEARD A LOUD NOISE, CROSSED TO THE OTHER SIDE AND FOUND 4 LOADED COAL CARS DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CARS HAD DERAILED ACCOUNT WIDE GAUGE.  THE TRACK IS OWNED BY TOMAHAWK RAIL HOWEVER, WISCONSIN CENTRAL DID THE MAINTENANCE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4823-d-07-24-00-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Object or equipment on or fouling track - other than above (for  vandalism, see code M503)
G4823-d-07-24-00-WC.Accident Cause: Object or equipment on or fouling track - other than above (for  vandalism, see code M503)
G4823-d-07-24-00-WC.Narrative: THE 2000 EW SWITCH JOB WENT INTO TRACK 65 TO PULL 36 CARS (21 LOADS AND 15 EMPTIES) DOWN TO THE MARSH LINE.  THE CREW COUPLED INTO THE CARS ON TRACK 65 AND WAS GOING TO STRETCH THE TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR HAD THE ENGINEER PULL THE TRACK DOWN APPROXIMATELY 12 CAR LENGTH WHEN HE NOTICED A GAP.  HE STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AND WALKED TO THE POINT AND GOT ON THE REAR CAR.  HE THEN INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TOBACK UP AND BEGAN COUNTING DOWN THE CARS TO THE COUPLING WHEN THE ENGINEER INFORMED HIM HE COUNDN'TMOVE THE CARS ANYMORE.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN TIED HAND BRAKES ON THE CARS THAT WAS GOING TO COUPLE INTO SO THAT THEY WOULD NOT ROLL BACK WHILE HE WENT TO INVESTIGATE WHAT THE PROBLEM WAS.  WHEN HE WALKED BACK HE FOUND THAT 4 CARS HA D DERAILED NEAR THE TRACK 65 SWITCH.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT A CAR ADBE 203 CAME OFF THE FROG ON TRACK 63 WHEN THE AIR HOSE AND GLAD HAND GOT CAUGHTIN POINT OF THE FROG AT 63 SWITCH.  THIS CAUSED THE WHEEL TO GO THE WRONG WAY AT THE FROG AND PULLED THE CARS OFF.NoneNoneNoneNone

G4821-d-07-02-00-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
G4821-d-07-02-00-WC.Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
G4821-d-07-02-00-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, THE 2330 WW SWITCH CREW HAD 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 87 LOADS ON TRACK 57.  THE SWITCH CREW HAD PUT CARS INTO TRACK 57 AND STOPPED WITH 8 TO 10 CAR LENGTHS OF ROOM ON THE WEST END.  AFTER THEY CUT AWAY, THE CONDUCTOR WAITED TO SEE IF THE CARS WOULD ROLL AND THEY DID NOT.THE CREW THEN PROCEEDED TO WORK ANOTHER TRACK, WITH ONLY 3 HANDBRAKES SET ON TRACK 57.  AS TRAIN FDIH1T-02 PROCEEDED TO ROLL OUT AT APPROXIMATELY 5 MPH ON TRACK 56, THE CARS ON TRACK 57 BEGAN TO ROLLOUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF THEIR TRAIN.  A TOTAL OF 8 CARS WERE DERAILED, 5 WERE ON THEIR SIDE, AND ANOTHER 3 CARS SUSTAINED DAMAGE IN THE IMPACT.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CONDUCTOR O THE 2330 WW SWITCH HAD NOT APPLIED A SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF HANDBRAKES ON TRACK 57 TO HOLD THE CARS IN PLACE, THUS ALLOWING THEM TO ROLL OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF A PASSING TRAIN.  THE 2330WW SWITCH CREW WAS TESTED, ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4820-d-07-01-00-WC.Narrative: TRAIN NBST2T, CONSISTED OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 23 LOADS AND EMPTIES, WHEN THEY SHOVED INTO WEST #1 TRACKAT CHIPPEWA FALLS.  THE ENGINEER TOLD THE CONDUCTOR THAT THEY WOULD SHOVE BACK INTO WEST #1 TRACK TOCLEAR FOR ANOTHER TRAIN.  HE ALSO INFORMED HIS CONDUCTOR THAT THEY WERE LINED UP WHEN IN FACT THEYHAD SHOVED THROUGH THE SWITCH.  AS NBST2T BEGAN TO PULL FORWARD, THEY HAD MOVED APPROXIMATELY 10 CARLENGTHS WHEN THE AIR DUMPED.  THE AIR THEN RESET AND THEY BEGAN TO PULL AGAIN WHEN IT DUMPED AGAINAFTER 15 CAR LENGTHS AND WOULD NOT RESET.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN WALKED BACK TO SEE WHAT THE PROBLEM WAS AND FOUND THE REAR CAR ON THR GROUND.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT DUE TO THE FACTTHAT THE CREW HAD NOT PROTECTED THEIR SHOVE MOVE, THEY SHOVED THROUGH AN IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH ANDTHEN PULLED BACK THROUGH IT CAUSING THE REAR CAR TO DERAIL. WHEN THIS CAR DERAILED IT SIDESWIPED ASTANDING CUT OF CARS ON TRSCK #2.  A TOTAL OF 34 CARS ON TRACK #2 SUSTAINED DAMAGE.  THE CREW WAS TESTED, ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNone

160047-d-07-30-00-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT #1390 WAS PULLING EASTWARD ON THE C-YARD LEAD FROM C-33 TRACK WITH 23 LOADS & 1 EMPTY, 2889 TON, 1457 FEET.  THE HUMP HAD RELEASED THE FOLLOWING CARS INTO C-25, LISTED FROM EAST TO WEST:  UTLX 50841, 128 TON, RELEASED FROM HUMP CREST @ 09:49.50 GPLX 77066, 131 TON, RELEASED FROM HUMP CREST @ 09:49.50 ACFX 54327, 117 TON, RELEASED FROM HUMP CREST @ 09:51.08 ACFX 59138, 117 TON, RELEASEDFROM HUMP CREST @ 09:51.08 UNPX122955, 121 TON, RELEASED FROM HUMP CREST @ 09:52.10 ACFX 97008, 125TON, RELEASED FROM HUMP CREST @ 09:53.25  THE COUPLED AND UNCOUPLED AIR HOSES ON THE ABOVE CARS WERECONSISTENT WITH THE PROYARD HUMP CREST RECORDED TIMES. UTILITY PERSON HAD POSITIONED HIMSELF ON THESOUTH SIDE OF C-25, NEXT TO THE TWO TRACK BUFFERS SOO 62516 (EAST) AND DJJX 846 (WEST).   THIS WASIN RESPONSE TO THE HUMP YARDMASTER'S NOTIFICATION THAT A NUMBER OF LOADS WERE BEING RELEASED INTO C-25.  THE TWO BUFFERS WERE EMPTY COAL HOPPERS.   AS THE FIRST SET OF HUMPED CARS (ACTUAL NUMBER UNKNOWN BY UTILITY PERSON) COUPLED TO THE BUFFERS, THE UTILITY PERSON JUDGED THAT THE SPEED WAS TOO GREATAND THE DISTANCE TO CLOSE TO THE CARS ON THE LEAD FOR HIM TO MOUNT THE CARS AND APPLY A HANDBRAKE TO SLOW THE MOVEMENT.   THE CARS ON C-25 COLLIDED WITH THE LAST THREE (WEST) CARS ON ASSIGNMENT #1390ON THE C-YARD LEAD.  FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF EFFECTED CARS EAST TO WEST:  ON C-YARD LEAD: CBRY 2633,LUMBER, LADING ONLY DAMAGED. MR  30134, LUMBER, NOT DERAILED BUT CAR DAMAGE. ENGX1

159650-d-07-06-00-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 634-034, DERAILED NINTH CAR, BGEX 443167, AT MP 235.0 ON THE DETROIT LAKES SUB.  THE CAR ROLLED OVER AND CAME TO REST ON IT'S SIDE CLEAR OF THE MT IN A SWAMP.  A HATCH WAS DAMAGED DURING THE DERAILMENT AND POTASH WAS RELEASED INTO THE SWAMP.  NO INJURIES WERE INCURRED IN THE INCIDENT.  -A- ENDOF HPJX 12346 (THE CAR ADJACENT TO DERAILED CAR) SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGES TO LEFT SIDE, BUT DID NOTDERAIL.   ALL APPROPRIATE ENTITIES WERE NOTIFIED.  APPROXIMATELY 200 FEET OF TRACK KINKED.  TRAIN 634-04 WAS TRAVELING EASTWARD ON THE DETROIT LAKES SUB. AT 1240 HRS TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. WHEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY THE CONDR. LOOKED BACK AND SAW 1 CAR LYING ON IT'S SIDE AWAY FROM THE TRK. HE WALKED BACK AND FOUND A GAP IN THE TRAIN AND THE BGEX 443167 LYING ON IT'S SIDE. THE TRAIN HAD JUST TRAVELED THRU A 4 MILE LONG 10 MPH RESTRICTION BETWEEN MP 240 & 236. REAR END HAD CLEARED RESTRICTION AND WAS INCREASING THROTTLE WHEN THE AIR WENT.   THE COND. WALKED THE TRAIN AND FOUND ONLY THE 1CAR DERAILED. SOME CARS WERE SITTING ON THE BUCKLED TRK.  WATER IS BEING MONITORED.  ROOT CAUSE OFINCIDENT: ANCHOR/RAIL MOVEMENT OF 2-1/2" TO WEST SLOWING TO 1-1/2" TO EAST OF SAG.  POOR TIE CONDITION WITH PLATES OFF TIES AND SPIKES OUT RESULTING IN A 40% DEFECTIVE TIE CONDITION.   SWAMP AREA, SWAMP TIES, MOVEMENT OF ROADBED, AND EXCESSIVE MOISTURE.   INSTALLATIN OF 5 PLATES AND ANCHORS RECENTLYSNUBBED UP TO TIES 70' IN EACH DIRECTION OF THE POINT OF DERAILMENT.  SLOW ORDER ONE MILE TO

159753-d-07-10-00-SOO.Other Railroad Name: IOWA CHICAGO AND EASTERN RR CORP
159753-d-07-10-00-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN IMRL 98 WAS PROCEEDING WESTWARD ON SOO TRACKAGE @ MINNESOTA CITY WITH 2 ENGINES & 20 CARS WHENIT COLLIDED WITH A THIRD PARTY GRAVEL TRUCK AT KIEPER ROAD CROSSING.  THE FORCE OF THE COLLISION CAUSED A DIESEL TANK RUPTURE TO LEAD ENGINE, IMRL 216, RESULTING IN THE LOSS OF APPROXIMATELY 1,000 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL.  AFTER THOROUGH INSPECTION OF ENGINES, SAME WERE SHUT DOWN AND TRAIN 211 WILLSHOVE TRAIN IMRL 98 TO MINNESOTA CITY ON THE MAIN TRACK, AS A WATER SOURCE ON THE SIDING PROHIBITS LEAKING EQUIPMENT FROM BEING STORED THERE.   THIRD PARTY VEHICLE DRIVER HAD EXITED HIS TRUCK AND WASWALKING AROUND AND LUCID AFTER THE COLLISION, AND WAS SUBSEQUENTLY TRANSPORTED TO LOCAL HOSPITAL FORMEDICAL ATTENTION. ALL APPROPRIATE ENTITIES ADVISED AND IMRL PERSONNEL TO SITE, ALONG WITH LOCAL AUTHORITIES. IMRL REPORTS THEIR EQUIPMENT DAMAGE IS ESTIMATED AT $22,000.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

453-d-07-25-00-CLP.Narrative: ON 07-25-00 CLP 263 WAS COMING OFF THE D&H HEADING EAST ON THE CLP WHEN THE LAST CAR (GATX 15022) OFTHE 8 CAR GAS TRAIN, THE LEAD WHEEL OF THE TRUCK WALKED UP AND OVER THE HIGH RAIL ON THE 12 DEGREECURVE JUST WEST OF THE CANAL BRIDGE (MI. A77.6). THIS CAR WAS THE 17TH CAR BACK FROM THE LOCOMOTIVES.  THE LEAD WHEEL WAS THE ONLY WHEEL OFF UNTIL THE TRUCK GOT OFF THE BRIDGE GUARDRAILS, THEN THE TRAILING WHEEL WENT OFF ALSO.  WHEN THE LAST CAR OF THE 8 CAR FUEL OIL TRAIN GOT TO THE SAME SPOT ON THE CURVE (GATX 69268), ITS LEAD WHEEL OF THE LEAD TRUCK WALKED UP AND OVER THE HIGH RAIL.  THIS WHEELFOLLOWED THE EXACT SAME PATH AS THE FIRST CAR, AND WHEN IT GOT TO THE END OF THE BRIDGE GUARDRAILSIT KEPT FOLLOWING THE PATH OF THE FIRST CAR.  THIS WAS THE 25TH CAR FROM THE HEAD END. AT THIS POINTTHESE TWO CARS WERE THE ONLY TWO ON THE GROUND.  THE TRAIN DRAGGED THESE TWO CARS THROUGH ANOTHER BRIDGE AND A CROSSING FOR APPROXIMATELY 1 MILE, BREAKING THE TIE ENDS OFF ALL THE CROSSTIES.  AT MI.A78.6 THE FIRST TRUCK THAT WAS DERAILED BROKE NORTH RAIL, THEN 7 CARS RODE OVER THE BROKEN RAIL ANDWHEN THE DERAILED TRUCK ON CAR# GATX 69268 THAT WAS ON THE GROUND CAME TO THE BROKEN RAIL, IT MISALIGNED THE RAILS AND THE FUEL CAR AND TWO GRAIN CARS (RUSX 800334, RUSX 800342) WENT INTO THE DITCH AND ROLLED ON THEIR SIDES AND PULLED THE PLYWOOD CAR (HS 3155) THROUGH THE BROKEN RAIL DERAILING THE LEAD TRUCK OF THAT CAR.  GATX 69268 LEAKED 15 GALLONS OF OIL.
